intro: Meehania fargesii var. radicans, commonly known as the creeping meehania, is a low-growing perennial plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, allowing it to spread along the ground. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
